alert.note: Alert for Cullman; Morgan (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 28 at 1:29AM CDT by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Cullman and southeastern Morgan Counties through 200 AM CDT... At 129 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Cullman, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Cullman, Good Hope, Holly Pond, Baldwin, Vinemont, Baileyton, West Point, Eva, Phelan and Walter. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
